head.supplied: 23/3/92 ¶ ¶ Only this afternoon, dear Consul Le Maistre, I became aware, that a French Warship was here, otherwise I would have paid my respects earlier to the Admiral and Officers at your Consular O...

div.p: Carton no. 12, Melbourne, consulat, Serie A, Centre des Archives Diplomatiques, Nantes.
MS annotation by [Maistre]: 'Transmis et Répondu le 24me' [Sent and replied the 24th]. Letter not found. For a printed version of this letter, see Home & Maroske (1997), p. 31. 23/3/92

That I have not become a stranger to French savants I may show by the fact, that only yesterday I received a most kind letter from Professor Milne-Edwards,
Letter not found. and some few weeks ago a splendid letter from Prof. de Quatrefages, just only some days written before his death.
Letter not found. A. Quatrefages de Bréau died on 12 January 1892.
As I live at so great a distance and the distinguished visitors will have their time so fully occupied, pray let them not trouble about me, because I sent merely these books.
